snippet: Ms. Abramson, who took over the newsroom in 2011, was abruptly dismissed and replaced by Mr. Baquet, the newspaper’s managing editor.
abstract: New York Times dismisses Jill Abramson as executive editor, replacing her with Dean Baquet, managing editor, in an abrupt change of leadership; Abramson had been in the job only since September 2011, but people in the company describe serious tension in her relationship with publisher Arthur Sulzberger Jr, who was concerned about complaints from employees that she was polarizing and mercurial; she had also had clashes with Baquet.

byline.original: By DAVID CARR and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Leslie Kaufman, Sydney Ember, Jonathan Mahler and Noam Cohen.

lead_paragraph: Ms. Abramson, who took over the newsroom in 2011, was abruptly dismissed and replaced by Mr. Baquet, the newspaper’s managing editor.

headline.main: Times Ousts Jill Abramson as Executive Editor, Elevating Dean Baquet
headline.print_headline: Times Ousts Its Executive Editor, Elevating Second in Command
